name: Menlo Park Terrace Elementary
general_info: Menlo Park Terrace School 19 is a community-based school that serves students in kindergarten through grade five. The school s academic curriculum includes language arts, math, reading, English and science. It is staffed with a superintendent, director, secretary, administrator, nurse and teachers. Menlo Park Terrace School 19 provides food items for breakfast and lunch, including sandwiches, entrees, burgers and pizzas. Its parent-teacher association conducts fundraising programs and regular meetings. The school is a part of the Woodbridge Township School District, which offers educational opportunities for the academic development of students. Menlo Park Terrace School 19 features a school band and organizes music programs. The school s library offers a collection of books and reference materials.

name: Avenel Street Elementary Schl
general_info: Avenel Street Elementary School is a part of the Woodbridge Township School District and provides academic classes to students in kindergarten through grade six. The school has a library and media center that provides access to a variety of resources and information to guide the educational process. Avenel Street Elementary conducts classes in language arts, mathematics, social studies, science, health and physical education, technology, and vocal and instrumental music. In addition, the school offers academic support instruction, child study, and off-site gifted and talented programs. Avenel Street School also offers the Drug Abuse Resistance Education (D.A.R.E) and accelerated reading programs. The school organizes reading and writing workshops for students who need extra assistance. Avenel Street School has a parent-teacher association that organizes various fundraising events, class trips and assemblies for students. The school is located in Woodbridge, N.J.

name: Woodbridge High School
general_info: Woodbridge High School is governed by the Woodbridge Township School District, which serves more than 13,000 students in over 20 schools. The school imparts education through several academic departments, such as business education, English, family and consumer science, fine arts, health, safety and physical education, industrial arts, mathematics, science, social studies and world languages. The school provides memberships to an array of extracurricular activity clubs and organizations, such as academic competitions, color guard, a dance team, film club, future problem solvers club, peer leadership and scholarship committee. The school s counselor offers student assistance services on various topics, including bias reduction, bereavement, health, interpersonal relationships and anger management. It is located in Woodbridge, N.J.

name: Woodbridge Middle School
general_info: Woodbridge Middle School enrolls more than 500 students in grades seven and eight. The school s curriculum is designed around a model of core academic subjects, including language arts, math, science and social studies. Additional instruction in computers, fine and performing arts, home and industrial arts, and physical education and health is also provided. A resource teacher is assigned to each grade level. The school also provides self-contained classrooms for students with special learning needs. The various clubs offered at the school include student council, art club, early act club, computer club, skills tutor and yearbook club. The school has a child study team, a speech pathologist, art therapist, school social worker and a student assistance counselor. Located in Woodbridge, N.J., the school is a part of the Woodbridge Township School District.

name: Sanford-Brown Institute-Iselin
general_info:
Sanford-Brown Institute in Iselin - Medical Billing, Massage Therapy & Medical Assistant    
   
The Sanford-Brown Institute opened in 1933 and is a private, career-oriented post-secondary learning institution offering focused, quality, short-term training programs in a variety of healthcare fields. Sanford-Brown operates in 15 campuses located in nine states. The short-term courses include training in Medical Billing and Coding, Massage Therapy, Medical Assistant and Diagnostic Medical Sonography (Diagnostic Medical Ultrasound).  
   
There is a difference here at Sanford-Brown Institute - Iselin. At Sanford-Brown, we are in the business of career education. That makes not only you, but also the employers we work with our customers. We care about you and your future, and your future employer's needs. That is the Sanford-Brown difference.

name: Iselin Middle School
general_info: Iselin Middle School, an educational institution, is a part of the Woodbridge Township School District, which operates various elementary, middle and high school campuses, as well as provides after-school child care services. It enrolls students in grades six through eight and provides instruction in various subjects, such as math, science, geography, social studies and language arts. The school conducts basic learning sessions in computer applications, foreign languages, music, cooking, health and physical education, and arts and crafts. Located in Iselin, N.J., it also has a library that stocks books under several titles, including poetry, business, social issues, biographies and encyclopedias. Iselin Middle School additionally provides special education services for disabled students.

name: J F Kennedy Memorial High School
general_info: Located in Iselin, N.J., John F. Kennedy Memorial High School serves students in grades 9 through 12. In addition to meeting the regular educational needs of students, the school provides several special education programs that address specialized needs of students in New Jersey. John F. Kennedy Memorial High School offers a range of advanced placement courses in English literature, calculus, American history, American government, psychology, chemistry, physics, Spanish and studio art. It operates several departments, such as fine arts, social studies, science, math, English, and health and physical education. John F. Kennedy Memorial High School also has a special service department for students with special needs. In addition, the school conducts classes in vocational education. It is a part of the Woodbridge Township School District.

name: The Goddard School
general_info: More than just daycare, The Goddard School located in Woodbridge offers a child care program that nurtures a lifelong love of learning by providing dedicated teachers in a private preschool setting.

We have an indoor and outdoor play area to make sure our students are exercising both their bodies and their minds.  Open year-round, we offer full and half day sessions for ages 2.5-5 years old and after school programs for ages 6 and up.

general_info: Mission: We believe that the Lutheran School is a proper response to God's concern for the Christian education of children as commanded by him in the great commission. name: Saint Joseph High School
general_info:
Are you looking for a private high school for your son that will provide them with the highest quality education possible, while at the same time building a firm foundation for faith and good works? Saint Joseph High School in Metuchen, NJ, is a private, all-boys Catholic high school located on a beautiful 70-acre campus. If you want your student to be immersed in a rich, diverse educational environment that will allow them to achieve their goals, Saint Joseph High School is your best choice. 
 
  Founded in 1963, Saint Joseph High School has a rich history of providing all of Middlesex County with exceptional faith-based academic services. Operated by the Brothers of the Sacred Heart, the staff of Saint Joseph High School is run by both Catholic and lay educators with a strong dedication to service and academic education. Building a strong foundation of trust within the community is important to Saint Joseph High School, they are committed to admitting any student regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin. Every student at Saint Joseph High School is treated with same high-level of respect and privy to all its academic and athletic programs. 
 
  The mission of Saint Joseph High School is to give students the best education possible by integrating Christian faith and values into the school curriculum. Their private high school staff wants each student to succeed, which is why they are proud to provide an educational framework designed to help students excel at any level. In addition to standard academic courses, such as math, English, and theology, students will also be able to participate in elective courses to improve their artistic abilities, study music and a host of other activities. The philosophy at Saint Joseph High School is to give students the tools they need to become life-long learners. 
 
  For those who are in need of a private high school that will give your child the tools they need to succeed in life, contact Saint Joseph High School today at (732) 549-7600. Serving all of Middlesex, Union, Essex, Hunterdon, Somerset and Monmouth counties, be sure to visit them online to see what makes them one of the area’s top-rated high schools.

name: Jewish Education Center
general_info: Jewish Educational Center operates various elementary, middle and high schools, including the Yeshiva and Rav Teitz Mesivta Academy and Bruriah High School for Girls. It focuses on study of Jerusalem and Torah studies. It offers various college preparatory programs for the students. It also offers instructional program in every subject that allows different learning styles and levels. Its Halacha and Jewish heritage program is taught from classical texts. The center s extracurricular activities and programs include plays, dramas and trips to various places. The organization also emphasizes on religious growth and experience of the students. Jewish Educational Center additionally offers adult education program and is located in Elizabeth, N.J.

Some of the social studies courses it offers include United States history, American government, global history and economics. Additionally, the school offers a number of online courses. Francis School is a member of the Military Child Education Coalition. The school holds accreditation from the New York State Department of Education.

St. Agnes School provides opportunities to participate in sports activities, including golf, basketball, cheerleading, baseball, volleyball, cross-country, and track and field. The school has a staff consisting of a counselor, nurse and teachers. It publishes a monthly newsletter that offers information about upcoming events for students and parents. name: Piscataway Regional Day School
general_info: Piscataway Regional Day School provides specialized programs to students between the ages of 13 to 21. The school provides classroom-based instruction to students suffering from autism and severe multiple disabilities. It offers various instructional programs, such as functional academics, communication and recreational skills, pre-vocational training, and music and art education. Piscataway Regional Day School also provides specialized services that include inclusion support, parent training, job sampling, community field trips, and augmentative communication evaluation and instruction. It maintains a staff of therapists, nurses, trained instructional aides, social workers, counselors and specialized teachers. It is a part of the Middlesex Regional Educational Services Commission, which provides a range of educational services and programs to school districts. Piscataway Regional Day School is located in Piscataway, N.J.

name: Middlesex Regional Educational Services Commission
general_info: Middlesex Regional Educational Services Commission provides several educational services and programs. It serves more than 4,000 nonpublic school students and offers specialized programs in compensatory education, supplementary instruction, English as a Second Language, home instruction, corrective speech, examination and classification, Title 1, and nursing and textbook services. The organization operates Raritan Valley Academy, which provides the school within a school design for students with behavioral, learning and linguistic disabilities. It provides several academic programs in subjects, such as language arts, English, spelling, handwriting, mathematics, science, social studies, physical education, computer science and remedial instruction. The organization offers various clinical support services, including individual and group counseling, life skill courses, anger management, career exploration and responsible parenting. Middlesex Regional Educational Services Commission is located in Piscataway, N.J.

name: Christopher Academy Montessori
general_info:
Christopher Academy offers an exceptional learning environment, tailored to the individual child, driven by the community. With homelike classrooms, the Montessori Method is filled with hands-on materials, each with a lesson to learn and a problem to solve. Our students enjoy a prepared environment designed to recognize and propel each child to learn, to grow, to achieve at the most appropriate pace to the best of his or her own ability. 
 
 
The oldest Montessori school in New Jersey, Christopher Academy has served children and families since 1963. A torch-bearer of excellence in Early Childhood and Montessori education, Christopher Academy helped to found the New Jersey Montessori Administrators' Council and established a high-quality Montessori teacher education program in the state. 
 
 
Graduates of Christopher Academy are regularly welcomed into the finest private elementary schools in the area. Others transition to their neighborhood schools with equal success. Christopher Academy guides the child to build his or her own foundation by providing challenging academic materials within a comfortable, child-directed environment. 
 
 
Christopher Academy ensures the quality of its program from classroom to classroom and campus to campus by supporting professional, career teachers. With the average faculty tenure approaching ten years, Christopher Academy provides a tradition and continuity of exceptional care. Each of our Lead Teachers is university educated, with many holding advanced degrees. Our Lead Teachers are all fully Montessori certified.  Our school's history includes professional teachers who have served children in our community for decades. 
 
 
Christopher Academy Core Values 
 
 
Having served our community since 1963, Christopher Academy has developed a system of core values that are anchored in the Montessori philosophy of education and the spirit of the best welfare for the child.   
  
 Christopher Academy is proud of its exceptional learning environment, carefully tailored to each individual child. Our students enjoy a prepared environment designed to recognize and propel each child to learn, to grow, to achieve at the most appropriate pace to the best of his or her own ability.   
   
Centered in the Montessori philosophy of peace and understanding of the child, our core values are: Respect, Acceptance, Care, Excellence, Education, Diversity, Individuality, and Responsibility.   
   
Respect   
 
 
We respect the child and each member of our community as a gift to us. We have an understanding of the relationship of the child not only to us, but also to all others in his or her life and all of the other happenings in his or her life.  We respect parents' concerns about their child and we provide an environment that follows our philosophy while understanding the concerns of parents for the child.

name: Eltingville Lutheran Church Defensive Driving
general_info:
The Driver Education Program at Moore Catholic High School is open to students of any high school on Staten Island who are enrolled in a diploma or certificate program as well as high school graduates. All course work and instruction is delivered by teachers certified according to the requirements of the Department of Education of the State of New York as well as the Department of Motor Vehicles. This Driver Education course includes 24 hours of classroom instruction, 6 hours of behind-the-wheel training and 18 hours of observation in the car. An MV-285 (Trained Driver Certificate) is awarded upon successful completion of the course. 
 
 
Our program is conducted as an after-school and summer program. 
 
 
Age Requirements: Permit and Driving Regulations 
 
 
The student must be 16 by the first day of the course but this is a minimum age. We recommend and prefer that a student be as close to the 17th birthday as possible when the course ends. The graduated licensing law does not all0w a road test unless the student is 17 or has additional hours of instruction. No permit is required for Driver Education in an approved high school. When Driver Ed. Is finished, 17 and 16 year old permit holders may practice with a parent only if there is a dual brake in the car. After passing the road test, 17 year olds may drive but 16 year olds have no driving privileges in NYC and must wait until they turn 17. 
 
 
Summer Hours: Mon - Fri. 8am to 1 pm

general_info: Mary J Donohoe School is located in Bayonne, N.J. The school is operated by the Bayonne Board of Education. It offers academic classes in prekindergarten through grade eight in various subjects, including reading, writing, spelling and vocabulary, English, math, science, social studies, language art and special education. The school has a media center that provides online encyclopedias, databases, facts and statistics, and dictionaries and thesaurus to its students for additional resources. It also offers sports activities, library, cafeteria, computer laboratory and food services. The school has a parent teacher association that sponsors various events and activities. Mary J Donohoe School has several clubs, including academic challenge, chess, computer club, quiz bowl, spelling bee and student council.

name: Katharine Gibbs School - Piscataway
general_info:
Gibbs College Can Provide Career Training to Help You Prepare For New Opportunities! 
At the Gibbs College Learning Site in Piscataway, New Jersey You Can Turn Your Talent into Exciting Career Opportunities. 
 
 
* Small classes with focused attention 
* Instruction from professionals in the field 
* Tuition planning and career support 
* Flexible Schedules that fit your work and life 
* Career Training that can help you gain confidence about your future 
 
 
Gibbs College offers the quality education you want with the convenience you need. It's a career training opportunity you love. 
 
 
Career training for those with a passion for business, fashion, criminal justice, visual communications, and the legal and healthcare field: Gibbs College in Piscataway offers programs that can be completed in as little as 12 months. Start loving what you do for a living with a specialized education from Gibbs College. 
 
 
Our programs include competency-based courses designed to develop proficiency in and advance technical skills reflective of those currently in demand in the marketplace. Taught by professionals in the field, the certificate emphasizes practical skills as well as skills in written and oral communications, literacy and technologies that can help students enter entry-level positions in specialized fields in today's business industries.

name: Old Bridge High School
general_info: Old Bridge High School, located in Matawan, N.J., is a Catholic institution that offers a variety of educational and extracurricular programs to students in grades nine through 12. The school has an enrollment of more than 3,000 students. It provides a variety of subjects, including English, fine arts, mathematics, science, social studies, computer science and physical education. It organizes various sports activities for students, including football, baseball, basketball, cross country, tennis, soccer, golf, volleyball and track. The school also offers various services, including student transcripts, lockers, school insurance, transportation and parking and cafeteria. It has a library that stocks a large collection of fiction, nonfiction, encyclopedias, reference notes and magazines. It also has a parent-teacher organization that involves parents in various educational activities of school.

name: Rutgers Preparatory School
general_info: Rutgers Preparatory School, founded in 1766, is a pre-kindergarten through twelfth grade co-educational independent day school. The School environment is enriched by students who come from a variety of geographic, economic and ethnic backgrounds. Our motto "Severa res est verum gaudium" (Hard work is true joy) expresses our desire that students will develop a positive attitude toward learning and that they will be rewarded with a strong sense of achievement. The School values intellectual curiosity and personal integrity, seeking to stimulate their development at every level. We emphasize a strong academic program, creative problem solving, cooperation and group interaction, appreciation of culture and beauty, and healthy emotional and physical growth.

name: Green Brook Middle School
general_info: Green Brook Middle School is a part of Green Brook Township Public Schools, which is a provider of educational services. Based in Green Brook, N.J., the school offers a vast curriculum that includes, language arts literacy, mathematics, science, social studies, Holocaust studies, character education, robotics, computer literacy, physical education, health education, engineering, vocal and instrumental music. The Parents Teaching Organization supports all aspects of the school community, including technology, libraries and playgrounds.

name: Renaissance Art Studio
general_info: At Renaissance, our goal is to combine art instruction with an individualized curriculum that provides every student with the opportuniy to explore, develop, and excel.  From child to adult, students develop insight into the arts using technique, planning, and execution as conveyed through our unique one on one instructional lessons. We have been in business for over twenty years!   Students will be exposed to various forms of mediums, including, but not limited to: graphite pencil drawing and illustration, charcoal, oil, and chalk pastels, watercolor, gouache, acrylic and oil paint, marker rendering, color pencils, sculpture and mixed media. We also offer Graphic design, Illustration, and photography with Digital Art and Design using the most current versions of Adobe illustrator, Photoshop, and In Design using Macintosh computers. All of our teachers are Certified Art Teachers who have been hand picked for their excellence and expertise in the field of visual arts.

general_info: Located in North Brunswick, N.J., Parsons Elementary School is an educational center that serves more than 600 students in kindergarten through grade five. The school has a parent-teacher association that raises funds for several projects, conducts monthly meetings and plans family activities. The association also sponsors book and fun fairs. Parsons Elementary School encourages its students to participate in various community projects. Its academic curriculum includes math, science, social studies, art, English and reading. The school also conducts classes in physical fitness and computer applications. The elementary school is a part of North Brunswick Township Public Schools, which operates several educational institutions.

name: Oak Knoll School of The Holy Child
general_info: About Us Oak Knoll School of the Holy Child is a Catholic independent school coeducational from kindergarten to grade 6 and for young women in grades 7 to 12. Oak Knoll was founded in 1924 and is one of eleven schools in the Holy Child Network of Schools that provides independent Catholic education across the United States. The Sisters of the Holy Child Jesus have also founded schools in England, Ireland, France, Nigeria, and Ghana. All Holy Child schools operate under the Society of the Holy Child Jesus, based in Drexel Hill, PA. Oak Knoll shares the goals of the Schools of the Holy Child Jesus.

The district s schools administer a range of academic and enrichment programs. It operates the Gifted and Talented Education programs. The Matawan-Aberdeen Regional School District s schools also administer special education programs and offer speech correction services. Its high and middle schools provide a variety of opportunities for several sports activities, such as soccer, baseball, football, softball, basketball and cross-country. The Matawan-Aberdeen Regional School District s schools offer food and transportation services.

name: Kent Place School
general_info: Founded in 1894, Kent Place School is an independent girls college that offers classes from prekindergarten through grades 12. It governs primary, middle, and upper schools that include science labs, art studios, and a computer lab. Its upper school curriculum offers English, math, science, history, social science, world languages, visual and performing arts, agriculture, vocational education, physical education, and elective options. It has an arts center that features a 260-seat theater, an art gallery, a dance studio, and practice rooms. The schools  athletic facilities include a field house, gymnasium and weight room, playing fields, and tennis courts. It offers a wide range of athletic programs, such as basketball, cross country, field hockey, squash, lacrosse, soccer, softball, swimming, tennis, indoor and outdoor track, and volleyball. The school is located in Summit, N.J.

name: East Brunswick Adult School
general_info: East Brunswick High School enrolls more than 2,000 students in grades 10 through 12. It was established in 1963 and provides courses in various subjects, such as mathematics, science, geography, economics, history, Spanish and English. Its extracurricular programs include drama, fine arts, music and physical education classes. It provides various after-school programs for the students. The sport activities offered by the school include baseball, cross country, soccer, basketball, softball and volleyball. It additionally has a library and media center that provides reference books, journals, newspapers and Internet access. It additionally has a student council that deals with extracurricular programs of students. East Brunswick High School is located in East Brunswick, N.J.

name: Port Richmond High School
address: 85 Saint Josephs Ave, Staten Island, NY 10302
general_info: Port Richmond High School has an enrollment of more than 2,600 students and is located in Staten Island, N.Y. Founded in 1927, the school offers advanced-placement courses in science research, medical technology, travel and tourism, calculus, European history and law. Its facility consists of catering kitchens, photography studio, dance room, robotics lab, printing and wood working shops, auto mechanics unit, computer labs and a television studio. The school also offers extracurricular activities, such as spring musical, drama club, concert band, jazz band, chorus, athletic teams, cheerleaders and yearbook. Additionally, the school operates a parent portal that provides information on instructional programs, enrollment procedures, rules and regulations, and health and support services. The school s health office provides care and preventive services, including therapies and assistive technologies. It consists of nurses, therapists, physicians, screening teams, and health and fitness educators.

name: Eden II Inst
general_info: Mission "The mission of the Eden II Programs is to provide people with autism specialized community based programs and other opportunities with the goal of enabling them to achieve the highest possible quality of living across their life spans. Eden II's success in providing quality services for children and adults with autism lies with its commitment to state of the art programming. Applied Behavior Analysis ( ABA ) provides the framework for all of the programs. Programs offered include preschool, elementary and secondary school services, adult day services, residential services, family services and outreach services to the community."

name: David Brearley Middle High
general_info: David Brearley High School serves students in grades 9 through 12. Its academic curriculum includes programs in computer applications, art, physical education, social studies and English. The school additionally has departments for mathematics, world languages, music, science and technology education. David Brearley High School has an athletics department that offers a variety of sports activities, such as wrestling, basketball, track and field and volleyball. It supports the National Honor Society, student council, and Spanish and Italian clubs. The school s media center stocks a range of print and multimedia reading and reference resources. In addition, it has a guidance and counseling department for students, teachers and parents. David Brearley High School is located in Kenilworth, N.J., and is a part of Kenilworth Schools.

name: West End Elementary School
general_info: West End Elementary School has an annual enrollment of more than 500 students in grades kindergarten through four. It offers a wide range of athletic activities, such as baseball, basketball, football, ice hockey, soccer, softball, volleyball, water polo, swimming and tennis. The school s academic curriculum includes math, science, social studies, music, physical education, health, art, English, reading, writing and technology. In addition, it has a library that provides curriculum-related materials to improve students reading skills and their abilities to use technology and books. West End Elementary School is a division of the North Plainfield School District and is located in North Plainfield, N.J.

name: Somerset School
general_info: Somerset Intermediate School, governed by the North Plainfield School District, serves students in grades five and six. The school offers social, studies, math, science, English and history. Its extracurricular activities include music, physical education, and arts and crafts. Somerset Intermediate School provides special education and gifted and talented programs. Then school offers various enrichment programs for the development of problem solving and decision making skills. It provides a range of sports activities, such as football, basketball, softball and soccer. In addition, Somerset Intermediate School hosts educational field trips and fun outings. The school offers membership options for drama, chorus, art and computer cubs, as well as a student council. It operates a parent-teacher organization that organizes various recreational activities and fundraising events.

name: Matawan Aberdeen Middle School
general_info: Matawan Aberdeen Middle School, located in Cliff wood, N.J., offers classes from grades six through eight. It provides classes in English, fine arts, technology, math, physical education, science, social science and special education. It has various clubs, such as literary, math, science and environmental. Its extracurricular activities include band, chorus, yearbook and student council. The school also has a parent-teacher student organization and guidance center. Its library provides various resources, such as books, magazines, encyclopedias and newspapers. It offers sports activities, including cross country, football, hockey, basketball, track, softball, baseball and tennis. Matawan Aberdeen Middle School is operated by the Matawan Aberdeen Regional School District.

name: Hammarskjold Middle School
general_info: Hammarskjold Middle School is a grade six to seven school with more than 1,500 students. It offers various academic programs in special education, English, foreign language, mathematics, physical education, science and social studies. Its library provides various resources, such as books, magazines, encyclopedias and newspapers. The school also has a parent-teacher student organization and guidance center. It provides Internet access and projectors in every classroom. It has an art gallery which features special projects completed by students. Its media center is equipped with computers, printers, scanners and digital camera. It has various clubs, including woodworking, international, homework, foods, interact, drama, computer and art enrichment. Hammarskjold Middle School is operated by East Brunswick Public Schools, and is located in East Brunswick, N.J.

name: Dunellen High School
general_info: Dunellen High School is an educational institution that is accredited by the New Jersey Department of Education. Located in Dunellen, N.J., the school enrolls students in grades 9 through 12. It provides a variety of general academic, advanced placement, vocational, elective and honors programs. The school s academic curriculum includes biology, economics, geometry, psychology, and family and life skills. It also conducts classes in French, Spanish, industrial arts and journalism. Dunellen High School offers a range of extracurricular activities, such as physical education, drama, choir, band, and visual and performing arts. The school also supports various sports activities that include softball, baseball, basketball, football, soccer, cross country, tennis, and track and field. It operates a parent-teacher organization that conducts several fundraising activities. The school is governed by Dunellen Public Schools, which operates elementary, middle and high schools. Dunellen High School additionally provides guidance counseling, meals and medical care.

name: Churchill Junior High School
general_info: Located in East Brunswick, N.J., Churchill Junior High School is operated by East Brunswick Schools. It is a coeducational school, and serves more than 1,500 students in grades eight and nine. The junior high school offers various academic courses, such as business education, computer studies, family and consumer science, and technology education. It provides a wide variety of clubs and extracurricular activities, including science team, sewing, Spanish club, natural helpers, peer mediation and tutoring, poetry club, intramurals, international club, computers and chorus ensemble. The junior high school provides variety of sport activities, including soccer, field hockey, cross country and football. The school offers various facilities, such as a media center with computer laboratories, library and cafeteria. Churchill Junior High School is designated as a Blue Ribbon School of Excellence by the Department of Education.

name: Jardine Academy
general_info: The Jardine Academy is a private school that offers an educational program that serves the cognitive and physical needs of children with multiple disabilities. The academy offers nursing and social work services, as well as physical, occupational, and speech and language therapies. It also offers mobility instruction utilizing the Mobility Options Via Education curriculum. The Jardine Academy has been recognized as New Jersey s First MOVE Model Site by MOVE International. In addition, the academy is approved by the NJ Department of Education. Its instruction addresses student self-care, interpersonal skills, health and fitness, and mobility and functional academics. The Jardine Academy is managed by Cerebral Palsy League.

The school s academic program includes various subjects, including math, science, social studies, health and technology education, art and foreign languages. The school employs a counselor who assists students with scheduling, educational planning, interpretation of test scores, career information, as well as home, school and personal concerns. The counselor provides personal and social development, educational and career counseling, crisis intervention and referrals to community agencies. Conackamack Middle School also organizes a range of sports programs and enrichment activities. The middle school has its campus in Piscataway, N.J.

name: Summit Speech School
address: 705 Central Ave Ste 1, New Providence, NJ 07974
general_info: Summit Speech School is a charitable, nonprofit corporation that serves children with hearing impairments. The school provides educational, therapeutic and support services to babies, preschoolers and their families through several auditory and oral programs. It enrolls more than 120 students from over 100 communities. Summit Speech School offers parent and infant, preschool and itinerant teacher of the deaf programs. The school provides ongoing audiological monitoring services to help children use their communication skills independently and develop socially. It also specializes in pre- and post-teaching of vocabulary and content. Founded in 1967, Summit Speech School is located in New Providence, N.J.

name: Summit Test Prep & Tutoring
general_info:
Summit Test Prep & Tutoring is committed to helping our clients scale new heights in academic performance and standardized test taking. 
 
 
Beginning with a free initial interview/assessment, we tailor an individualized learning plan that meets a client's needs and supports his or her goals. Then, in one on one session, we forge a connection that inspires trust to create a partnership for progress.  Success builds upon itself so that learning is enjoyable, as learning should be.  
 
 
While our experienced staff members are adept at instructing a wide range of learners in a variety of subject areas, we specialize in preparing college-bound students to take standardized tests such as the SAT and ACT, with our focus on reading, writing, math, and test taking skills.  Other tests for which we have prepared clients include the GED, NJ ASK, GRE, GMAT, ASVAB, SSAT, ISEE, and COOP.   
 
 
Subject area tutoring includes math, science and several languages including English as a second language, Spanish, Italian, French, German, and Russian.   
 
 
We are available to meet with clients at our Summit location, in the home, or at another convenient spot such as the local public library. 
 
 
Flexible Location:  One-on-one tutoring and test preparation can be provided in our quiet, distraction-free office or in the comfort of your home. Our office is conveniently located on Broad Street in Summit.  
 
 
Scheduling:  Tutoring sessions are scheduled as you feel you need them. If you feel you only need one or two sessions, that's all you pay for. Tutors are available evenings and weekends to work around your schedule.   
 
 
Effective Experience:  Our test prep coaches are seasoned tutors and have expertise in a variety of fields. All are college graduates and many possess or are currently pursuing advanced degrees. All have scored above the 90th percentile on a national exam such as the SAT, ACT, or GRE.  
 
 
Tutor Matching:  If for any reason you are unsatisfied with a tutor, we'll find another to match your child's personality and learning style.  
 
 
Satisfaction Guarantee:  Services are guaranteed -- if you don't feel the session was helpful, there is no charge.  
 
 
Summit Test Prep & Tutoring helps students build skills and confidence in a relaxed and comfortable environment. Let us help your child create the foundation for a successful future today!

name: Project Training Institute
general_info: Very affordable -- a live class for less than some online courses. Convenient -- classes are held in the evenings and on weekends at our center in Summit, NJ. We also offer our course in other locations, including Princeton, NJ and Long Island, NY. If you would like us to deliver our course at your site, please contact us for a quote. Meets eligibility requirements -- our comprehensive PMP certification exam preparation course provides the 35 hours of project management education that PMI requires to be eligible for the exam and covers all the topics you will need to know. Project management training topics include the management of time, scope,cost, quality, human resources, communications, and procurement. Small class size -- maximum 10 students per PMP exam preparation class is conducive to rapid learning. Guaranteed -- if you do not pass the PMP exam within 60 days of taking our course, you may take the course again for free or have us pay your PMP reexamination fee (up to $275).

address: 44 Dongan Hills Ave, Staten Island, NY 10306
general_info: We'd like to tell you about our agency. When families are in need of the highest quality services for their children who may have emotional disturbances, behavioral disorders, developmental challenges, chemical addictions, or a range of other mental health problems, they turn to the Staten Island Mental Health Society (SIMHS.org) for help. The SIMHS is a private, not-for-profit agency that provides comprehensive mental health and related services to Staten Island children who are emotionally or behaviorally disturbed, developmentally or learning disabled, neurologically impaired, dependent on alcohol or drugs, and/or economically disadvantaged. Our goal is to help these children and their families improve the quality of their lives and enhance their futures. Our 300 professional and support staff provide assistance to more than 5, 000 individuals each year (over one-in-ten Staten Island families) at our 21 program sites throughout the borough. Moreover, we have provided free September 11th-related services to more than 2, 000 people who were affected by the terrorist attacks on New York. In addition, our more than 500 volunteers contribute 50, 000 hours of service. The SIMHS is a member of the Staten Island Smoke-Free Parnership that supports neighborhood efforts to reduce tobacco use. For more information go to

general_info:
Anthem Education Group is a family of accredited schools and colleges where students get the education and hands-on training they need to begin careers in the healthcare, technology, business, and legal fields. Our schools offer flexible schedules, the convenience of studying close to home, and instructors with experience in the fields they teach. Students learn in classrooms, watch demonstrations of the techniques they need to know, and practice their skills in labs designed to look like real workplaces. From the time they enroll, we work with our students to make sure they stay on track with their studies. We help students get tutoring they may need, secure part-time job while in school, even help find childcare or housing. All students work with our Career Services professionals to learn how to create a resume and conduct a job search. Financial aid is available to those who qualify. Prospective students can also apply to Anthem College Online, where they attend classes and discussion groups through the Internet, using interactive technologies that keep them interested and engaged in learning. Not all programs are available at all locations. For more information about our graduation rates, the median debt of students who completed the program, and other important information, please visit our website at www.anthem.edu/disclosures.

general_info: Our Mission & Core Values:  "To have all children be active learners who participate in constructing knowledge and understanding; and provide them with the necessary resources and learning opportunities so they can transform their thoughts into concrete tools that can be used to shape and control their environment."  Our school mission enables both staff members and students alike to work towards their full potential each day. Students strive for excellence, grow and develop in a positive, supportive, and collaborative atmosphere. In this way, everyone experiences success as well as develop an intrinsic love for life-long learning. LLACS seeks to provide a high performing Science, Math and Technology school for its students.  Our Core Values:  Lady Liberty Academy Charter School has set 7 "Core Values" for our students. name: Aquinas Academy
general_info: Founded in 1952, Aquinas Academy is a Catholic-based educational institution that provides a variety of academic programs to students. It offers classes in reading, writing, spelling, vocabulary, English, math, social studies, music, physical education, computer technology, language arts, and foreign languages, such as Spanish. The school additionally provides classes in dance and Bible reading. It offers the English as a Second Language program. The school provides various sports activities, including basketball, baseball, softball and cheerleading. It operates a student council that conducts several field trips, concerts and music festivals. The school is accredited by the Middle States Association of Colleges and Schools. It is a part of the St. Philomena's Roman Catholic Church, which offers spiritual and educational services. Aquinas Academy is located in Livingston, N.J.

name: Newark Academy
general_info: Newark Academy at Livingston, founded in 1774, offers a variety of academic and supports programs to middle and high school students. The academy provides programs in English, foreign languages, health, humanities, mathematics and physical education. It also offers various classes in arts education, including theater, dance, music and visual arts programs. Newark Academy at Livingston provides a range of counseling programs that include college planning and visits programs.  Its staff includes counselors, teachers, advisors, administrators and coaches. The academy also provides various sports activities, such as football, field hockey, volleyball, soccer, cross country, tennis, basketball, swimming, wrestling and baseball. The academy is located in Livingston, N.J.

name: Sojourner Truth Middle School
general_info: Sojourner Truth Middle School, governed by the East Orange School District, serves students in grades six through eight. The school offers opportunities to study science, technology and African-centered courses. It is centered on a science and technology-based curriculum. Sojourner Truth Middle School conducts sessions in the fields of television production, computer drafting, and aircraft design. The school provides assistance to develop computer technology and Internet access capabilities of students. It also offers project works in mathematics, social studies and communications. Sojourner Truth Middle School utilizes a 3-D technology to generate research information, analyze data and produce final work products. The school provides courses for students to develop technical skills in computer applications and Web building. In addition, it hosts science fairs and exhibitions.

name: Marion P Thomas Charter School
general_info: History  Celebrating Our 10th Anniversary!  Marion P. Thomas Charter School (MPTCS) received its charter in 1998 and opened in 1999 with 60 students in grades K-2. MPTCS was conceived by a group of committed Newark community activists and parents, under the direction of the late Rev. Dr. Charles E. Thomas, pastor emeritus of The New Hope Baptist Church in Newark. With a commitment of $1 million from New Hope, MPTCS opened its doors in a four classroom facility in the North Ward. Today, there are 540 students in grades K-8 operating out of two campuses. Grades K-4 at 370 S. 7th St., headed by Principal Dabney and a Middle School (Grades 5-8) at 308 S. 9th St, headed by Principal Gamble.

name: Somerset County Vo-Tech
general_info: Sesomerset County Vocational and Technical High School is a fully accredited, four-year high school located on a more than 80-acre campus on North Bridge Street and Vogt Drive in Bridgewater, N.J. It accepts students on a full- and shared-time basis for more than 20 educational programs that combine training in occupational and academic skills. Shared-time students earn a certificate in their shop program and attend their hometown district for academic courses. The school also offers an award-winning gifted and talented performing arts program, with emphasis in dance, theater arts and musical theater. It offers a variety of extracurricular activities throughout the year, from club-sponsored events to plays and dance concerts. Its students participate in various fundraising projects that benefit county organizations, such as the American Cancer Society, the Food Bank and the American Heart Association.

name: East Orange Campus High School
general_info: East Orange Campus High School is a college preparatory school that provides educational classes to students in grades 10 through 12. The school teaches visual and performing arts, law, culinary arts, business management, desktop publishing, art, animation, math, science, social studies and physical education. It provides membership for various clubs, such as flag twirlers, legal debate, campus care, community service, elite fashion and the Future Business Leaders of America. The school organizes various sporting events that includes track and field, football, soccer, tennis and volleyball. East Orange Campus High School is a part of the East Orange School District and is located in East Orange, N.J.

name: John L Costley Middle School
general_info: John L. Costley Middle School is an educational institution that enrolls children in grades six through eight. It is located in East Orange, N.J., and conducts classes in various subjects, such as English, mathematics, social studies, geography, history and economics. The school offers the language arts program that improves the reading, writing, listening, viewing and speaking skills of students. Its extracurricular activities include folk tales, dance, music, museum exhibits, field trips, drama, computer learning, and arts and crafts. John L. Costley Middle School also celebrates the Law, National History and United Nations Days. The school is a part of the East Orange School District, which operates several early childhood, elementary, secondary and high school campuses.

general_info: Lincoln Avenue Elementary School, established in 1892 and located in Orange, N.J. The school offers classes from grades kindergarten through six, and serves more than 600 students. Its sports activities include football, baseball, softball, kickball, and track and field. The school organizes parent-teacher association that assists in various school activities. It also provides transportation, health care and food service. and also associated with various fund-raising community programs and services. The school is also associated with various community programs. Lincoln Avenue Elementary School has a student council, which assists in organizing various activities, such as projects and trips. The school also offers special education programs to the underprivileged students.

Located in East Orange, N.J., Bernie L. Edmondson Community Education Center is governed by the East Orange School District, which operates several elementary, middle and high schools that provides academic education to more than 11,000 students in pre-kindergarten through grade 12.

general_info: Roosevelt Middle School serves students in grades seven and eight. The school organizes various field trips, competitions, and music and sports programs. In addition, middle school operates a library media center that has a collection of books and periodicals that complements the academic curriculum. Roosevelt Middle School is located in West Orange, N.J.

general_info: Founded in 1896, Forest Street School is a learning organization that offers classes in a range of subjects, such as math, science, history and language arts. The school s counselor offers group and individual counseling and provides information on a range of topics, such as anger management, raising grades, retention and friends. Forest Street School has a library that provides access to resources for students and staff in curriculum areas and also offers a variety of print and electronic sources to assist in the learning process. The elementary school conducts regular meetings and organizes fundraising events, field trips, and parent information and workshops. Forest Street School is located in Oragne, N.J.

name: The Learning Annex - Little Village
general_info:
Opened Early and Closed Late For Your Working Convenience! 
 
 
Child Care: 
 
 
We provide an environment in which children's natural sense of wonder and curiosity is encouraged. We believe children can be taught in an exciting and motivating way. Our teachers encourage a love of learning by providing many enriching opportunities. 
 
 
Care for Children with Special Needs: 
 
 
The Learning Annex of Monmouth County is a premium child care and educational center specifically serving young children with early signs of learning difficulties, and suspected or diagnosed Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD's) 
 
 
We care for children as young as 12 months of age, and up to 5 years of age because we believe that early intervention in an appropriate setting for young children is critical to gain maximum benefit from existing therapies. 
 
 
If your child is diagnosed with an ASD (Classic Autism, Asperger's Syndrome, Pervasive Developmental Disorder (PDD), CALL US 
 
 
We offer unsurpassed care exceeding State regulations, with an in-depth, individualized educational program (IEP) developed specifically for your child.  Our IEP focuses on building communication through one-on-one teaching, social skills through one-on-on and inclusion therapies, and cognitive skills through fine and gross motoring activities.   We bring families and children together full-circle with on-site child study teams, speech therapists, physical therapists, family support groups, and evening and weekend activities  all under one roof.

name: Central Elementary School
general_info: Central Elementary School offers education to students in kindergarten through sixth grade. Its academic curriculum includes language arts, mathematics, music, science and physical education. Its language arts class addresses student needs in the areas of writing, reading, listening, speaking and viewing. The school also offers education to students with various learning disabilities. Additionally, the school has a computer laboratory that offers more than 20 computers. Central Elementary School also organizes a range of extracurricular programs that include book fairs, talent shows, science fairs, concerts and multicultural festivals. The school is a part of the Orange Board of Education and is located in Orange, N.J.

name: Heywood Avenue Elementary School

The school s academic curriculum includes various subjects, such as art, science, music, world languages and physical education. It also offers special education programs for students with special needs. The school has a parent-teacher association that conducts several fundraising programs and supports student activities. It conducts staff development programs for teachers and staff members. In addition, the school provides opportunities for students to participate in after-school tutorial programs and various clubs. Its campus includes a gymnasium, auditorium, 28-station computer laboratory and library. Heywood Avenue Elementary School is located in Orange, N.J.

Gordon Parks Academy is located in East Orange, N.J., and is a part of The East Orange School District, which is located in Essex County, N.J. name: CCLC (Childrens Creative Learning Center)
general_info: CCLC® provides early childhood education designed especially to meet the needs of working families. Through these programs, working families have access to both a convenient location as well as age-appropriate curriculum. CCLC prides itself on preparing children for their school years by offering lesson plans that include phonics, reading, math, and science. You will gain peace of mind knowing that each day your child is being cared for in an enriched learning environment that encourages social, emotional, physical and intellectual growth while promoting a strong love of learning.

name: Middletown Village Elementary
general_info: Middletown Village Elementary School is a part of Middletown Township Public Schools, which provides educational services to more than 10,000 students in kindergarten through 12. The school provides educational classes to students in kindergarten through grade five. Middletown Village Elementary School features several enrichment activities, such as student clubs, tutorial sessions, cultural arts programs, academic competitions and field trips. It has a learning resource center that houses supplemental multimedia materials and a variety of recreational and informational reading selections. In addition, the school has a cafeteria that offers a variety of food items. Its academic curriculum includes language arts, math, music, physical education, science, art, social studies, life skills and technology. The school organizes several extracurricular programs, such as field days, dance teams, choir, speech contests and science fairs. It additionally maintains a media center that has more than 30 computers and provides instruction in technical education. The school offers several athletic activities, such as basketball, volleyball, track and field and cheerleading. It publishes a newsletter that provides school updates and student announcements. St. Mary's School is located in Newark, N.J.

Each academic enrichment program is informed by research-based innovative methods of early childhood education. By exploiting the developmentally impactful period in a child’s life through a unique multisensory approach, FasTracKids increases their capacity for critical thinking. From Math and English programs to ERB test prep, it is the interactive learning environment, as well as state-of-the-art educational technologies which makes it fun for kids to discover and explore new concepts and ideas. 
 
  One of the learning center’s foremost programs is the FasTracKids CORE. The CORE is an enrichment program designed to stimulate the mental development of your inherently gifted three to seven year old child. Professional educators tirelessly pursue the goal of preparing children for school and life by developing creative thinking, problem solving, and communication skills. 
 
  FasTracKids / Eye Level Learning Center facilitates learning processes in 12 subject areas with fun, learning activities for kids. Whether your child needs help retaining their everyday elementary curriculum, or test prep in New York, visit FasTracKids online to find out how to give your child they confidence they need to succeed.

name: The Uncommon Thread
general_info: The Uncommon Thread was born from the idea that everyone can learn. Kids discover their world through common threads of learning. When the basic elements of learning fail children on the spectrum, we must strive to remember that it is not about "Can they learn?" - but rather the discovery of the uncommon thread that will connect concepts to words and make learning possible.  VISION & PHILOSOPHY  Families face an ever present disconnect in the fight to save their child from communication and Behavior disorders which impede the learning process. Often frustrated and feeling helpless, parents can become immobilized in their effort to navigate the waters of early intervention. The Uncommon Thread has created an environment where early intervention becomes a comprehensive, cohesive strategy between parents, specialists, therapists, and educators in order to team up and fight the debilitating affects that occur with children who have learning differences.  At The Uncommon Thread, we believe in early intervention, thoughtfully constructed programs, and a collaborative team approach implemented in a holistic environment. Our team consists of experienced professionals who have witnessed and believe in the positive outcomes of early intervention programs. An appropriate early intervention program can significantly improve the quality of life for a child with developmental and Behavior disorders. However, there is a narrow window of opportunity in which implementing a program can create the highest impact. These children don’t learn in the same way that typical developing children learn. For this reason it is imperative to devise methods of teaching that develop and strengthen the skills necessary for natural learning to take place.

name: Treasure Island

Throughout the years, our program has always stressed the view that all children are unique individuals with unique abilities and interests that need to be nourished and supported. It is firmly believed that by capitalizing on children's strengths and interests they will be appropriately engaged in learning that will promote a strong sense of self-worth, develop a great sense of self-esteem and self-confidence, and promote a love of learning and discovery.  The curriculum at Treasure Island emphasizes the development of the whole child. Our learning environment is designed to promote social/emotional development, physical development, cognitive development and language and literacy development for all of our children.The curriculum emphasizes child choice within a classroom organized around interest areas such as blocks, art, science, math, dramatic play, and literacy.  In these learning centers, teachers work with children individually or within small groups to guide and facilitate their learning. The program stresses a balanced approach between child initiated learning and using direct teacher instruction. Another key emphasis of the curriculum is creating a classroom community and establishing secure relationships which will support children's enthusiasm and engagement in learning. In addition, the school has a library and media center that offers a range of books and instructional materials. It conducts classes for instrumental and vocal music and chorus. Mount Vernon School is located in Newark, N.J. The school is a part of the Newark Public Schools, which operates several elementary, middle and high schools.

name: Childtime
general_info: Quality child care for babies, infants, toddlers and school-age children in Somerset, NJ. Childtime offers daycare, preschool, pre-k, kindergarten, before & after school programs and summer camp.

name: Mater Dei High School
general_info: Located in New Monmouth, N.J., Mater Dei High School serves students in grades 9 through 12. The school s core curriculum includes English, science, math, history and social studies. It also offers classes in art, music and physical education. Mater Dei High School s course in art fundamentals includes photography, drawing, sculpture, painting, graphic design, portfolio preparation and video production. The school additionally operates a foreign language department that hosts instruction sessions in Spanish, French and Latin. It provides a range of sports activities, including, cross-country, hockey, football, soccer, swimming, basketball, track, tennis, softball, baseball and golf. Mater Dei High School offers various enrichment programs to enhance motor, cognitive and language abilities.

name: South Mountain Elementary School-Upper Elementary School
address: 444 W South Orange Ave, South Orange, NJ 07079
general_info: South Mountain Elementary School serves students in grades two through five. The school offers a variety of educational and extracurricular services. It conducts classes in English, math, science, social studies and history. South Mountain Elementary School also offers music and special education classes. The school additionally maintains a library that provides books and catalogs on various topics. It provides a range of medical and counseling services for students. In addition, South Mountain Elementary School maintains a parent-teacher association that encourages parental involvement in children s education. The school is a part of the School District of South Orange and Maplewood, which operates several elementary, middle and high schools. It is located in South Orange, N.J.

name: St Vincent's Parochial School
general_info: St. Vincent Martyr School, founded in 1848, serves students in kindergarten through grade six. Its academic curriculum includes various subjects, such as English, math, science, social studies and religious education. The school also offers a range of extracurricular programs in art, music, and computer and physical education. In addition, St. Vincent Martyr School conducts foreign language programs in Spanish. It supports a variety of sports activities, such as golf, hockey, football, basketball and cheerleading. St. Vincent Martyr School is located in Madison, N.J.

name: Gregory Elementary School
general_info: Gregory Elementary School enrolls students in kindergarten through grade five. It provides several educational programs for the intellectual, physical, emotional and social development of children. The school s academic curriculum includes several subjects, such as language arts, science, social studies and math. Gregory Elementary School also provides instruction in art, world languages, music and physical education, as well as offers the English as a Second Language program. The school s media center has a collection of print, nonprint and electronic resources. It maintains a parent-teacher association that organizes a range of fundraising events, such as annual book fairs, dance nights, plant sales, winter concerts and walkathons. Gregory Elementary School is a part of West Orange Public Schools and is located in West Orange, N.J.

name: Immaculate Conception Convent
general_info: Established in 1960, Immaculate Conception School serves students in kindergarten through grade five. The school offers classes in social studies, science, math, reading, Spanish and writing, as well as serves more than 300 students. It also provides various student programs, such as computer, music, art and physical education. Immaculate Conception School s sports activities include softball, soccer, basketball and baseball. In addition, the school offers after-school child care programs that include storytelling and indoor and outdoor play activities. Its cafeteria provides nutritious meals to its students. The school has a staff of over 30 teachers. Immaculate Conception School maintains a location in Spotswood, N.J.

general_info:
Located in Stirling, serving Berkeley Heights, Warren, Basking Ridge, New Providence, Bernardsville, Bedminister, Green Brook Township and Watchung.
